CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 11, 1958, pg. 3, reads: "'Best Wishes, Mayor' - Police Magistrate Robert E. Williams extends best wishes to Mayor David L. Lawrence, who began an unprecedented fourth term as the city's chief executive this week. Mr. Williams was re-appointed police magistrate." Cutline for image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 8, 1958, pg.10, reads: "Old Pictures Portray New Story - Our readers might get the impression that Mayor David L. Lawrence, right, is smiling in delight after submitting to the slate-makers' draft last Monday and becoming a candidate for Governor - a decision which restores some semblance of harmony in Democratic ranks. On the left, it could well be, that the Mayor is being told by Police Magistrate 'Pappy' Williams: 'I'm for you, Mayor, and you can depend upon the Fifth Ward.' But the smiling picture of the Mayor was photographed during last year's campaign, while the other picture carried 'best wishes' of Magistrate Williams after the Mayor had been sworn in early this year to begin his unprecedented fourth term as the city's chief executive. - Harris Photo."Cutline for image published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 11, 1964, pg. 3, reads: "WITH DAVE LAWRENCE - Pittsburgh political leader Dave Lawrence, whom "Pappy" aided greatly in becoming Mayor of Pittsburgh and later Governor of Pennsylvania is shown congratulating Mr. Williams whom Lawrence appointed a police magistrate in 1946. - Harris Photo."David L. Lawrence was Mayor of City of Pittsburgh 1946-1959, Governor of Pennsylvania 1959-1963, and he died in 1966.
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence shaking hands with Robert E. "Pappy" Williams, surrounded by other men, after Lawrence's election for fourth term, in Pittsburgh City Council Chambers, City County Building
